    • Method Detail

      • exFindNode

        Node exFindNode(java.lang.String node_name,
              Vdc vdcs)
        Searches for node across specified vDCs. This is more effective than querying all nodes to get a single instance.
        Parameters:
        node_name - The name of the node to search for (:type node_name: ``str``)
        vdcs - None, vDC or a list of vDCs to search in. If None all vDCs will be searched. (:type vdcs: :class:`Vdc`)
        Returns:
        node instance or None if not found (:rtype: :class:`Node` or ``None``)

      • exFindNode

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        node instance or None if not found (:rtype: :class:`Node` or ``None``)

        Node exPowerOffNode(Node node)
        Powers on all VMs under specified node. VMs need to be This operation is allowed only when the vApp/VM is powered on.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to be powered off (:type node: :class:`Node`)
        Returns:
        `Node`

      • exPowerOnNode

        Node exPowerOnNode(Node node)
        Powers on all VMs under specified node. This operation is allowed only when the vApp/VM is powered off or suspended.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to be powered on (:type node: :class:`Node`)
        Returns:
        `Node`

      • exQuery

        java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> exQuery(java.lang.String type,
                                                                       java.lang.String filter,
                                                                       int page,
                                                                       int page_size,
                                                                       java.lang.String sort_asc,
                                                                       java.lang.String sort_desc)
        Queries vCloud for specified type. See http://www.vmware.com/pdf/vcd_15_api_guide.pdf for details. Each element of the returned list is a dictionary with all attributes from the record.
        Parameters:
        type - type to query (r.g. user, group, vApp etc.) (:type type: ``str``)
        filter - filter expression (see documentation for syntax) (:type filter: ``str``)
        page - page number (:type page: ``int``)
        page_size - page size (:type page_size: ``int``)
        sort_asc - sort in ascending order by specified field (:type sort_asc: ``str``)
        sort_desc - sort in descending order by specified field (:type sort_desc: ``str``)
        Returns:
        ``list`` of dict

      • exQuery

        java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> exQuery(java.lang.String type)
        Queries vCloud for specified type. See http://www.vmware.com/pdf/vcd_15_api_guide.pdf for details. Each element of the returned list is a dictionary with all attributes from the record.
        Parameters:
        type - type to query (r.g. user, group, vApp etc.) (:type type: ``str``)
        Returns:
        ``list`` of dict

      • exSetVmCpu

        void exSetVmCpu(java.lang.String vapp_or_vm_id,
              int vm_cpu)
        Sets the number of virtual CPUs for the specified VM or VMs under the vApp. If the vapp_or_vm_id param represents a link to an vApp all VMs that are attached to this vApp will be modified. Please ensure that hot-adding a virtual CPU is enabled for the powered on virtual machines. Otherwise use this method on undeployed vApp.
        Parameters:
        vapp_or_vm_id - vApp or VM ID that will be modified. If a vApp ID is used here all attached VMs will be modified (:type vapp_or_vm_id: ``str``)
        vm_cpu - number of virtual CPUs/cores to allocate for specified VMs (:type vm_cpu: ``int``)

        return ``None``

      • exSetVmMemory

        void exSetVmMemory(java.lang.String vapp_or_vm_id,
                 int vm_memory)
        Sets the virtual memory in MB to allocate for the specified VM or VMs under the vApp. If the vapp_or_vm_id param represents a link to an vApp all VMs that are attached to this vApp will be modified. Please ensure that hot-change of virtual memory is enabled for the powered on virtual machines. Otherwise use this method on undeployed vApp.
        Parameters:
        vapp_or_vm_id - vApp or VM ID that will be modified. If a vApp ID is used here all attached VMs will be modified (:type vapp_or_vm_id: ``str``)
        vm_memory - virtual memory in MB to allocate for the specified VM or VMs (:type vm_memory: ``int``)

        return ``None``

      • exAddVmDisk

        void exAddVmDisk(java.lang.String vapp_or_vm_id,
               int vm_disk_size)
        Adds a virtual disk to the specified VM or VMs under the vApp. If the vapp_or_vm_id param represents a link to an vApp all VMs that are attached to this vApp will be modified.
        Parameters:
        vapp_or_vm_id - vApp or VM ID that will be modified. If a vApp ID is used here all attached VMs will be modified (:type vapp_or_vm_id: ``str``)
        vm_disk_size - the disk capacity in GB that will be added to the specified VM or VMs (:type vm_disk_size: ``int``)

        return ``None``
